doc.previous: Pollution began to draw major public attention in the United States between the mid 1950s and early 1970s when Congress passed the Noise Control Act the Clean Air Act the Clean Water Act and the National Environmental Policy Act 14
doc.after: Severe incidents of pollution helped increase consciousness PCB dumping in the Hudson River resulted in a ban by the EPA on consumption of its fish in 1974 Long term dioxin contamination at Love Canal starting in 1947 became a national news story in 1978 and led to the Superfund legislation of 1980 15 The pollution of industrial land gave rise to the name brownfield a term now common in city planning
